intro: Fregirardia leptoclada, commonly known as the slender leaf fregirardia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, delicate leaves that give it a lacy appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
